abstract: Palo Alto Research Center, the Xerox spin-off that is hoping to sustain itself by licensing technology and forming partnerships with outside companies, is announcing a deal Friday that underscores that strategy. The New York Times reports that PARC, as it’s known, is licensing a broad portfolio of patents and technology to a well-financed start-up with an ambitious and potentially lucrative goal: to build a search engine that could some day rival Google.
lead_paragraph: Palo Alto Research Center, the Xerox spin-off that is hoping to sustain itself by licensing technology and forming partnerships with outside companies, is announcing a deal Friday that underscores that strategy. The New York Times reports that PARC, as it’s known, is licensing a broad portfolio of patents and technology to a well-financed start-up with an ambitious and potentially lucrative goal: to build a search engine that could some day rival Google.

headline.main: In a Search Refinement, a Chance to Rival Google
